segments.content: A few days ago, Vercel announced a critical 9.1 vulnerability in Next.js middleware system. With a simple but malicious `x-middleware-subrequest` header, you can bypass the middleware, possibly exposing sensitive information. Patches are available for Next.js 12/13/14/15. Note that this vulnerability only affects self-hosted apps using `output: ‘standalone’` and `next start` are affected. Customers of major serverless cloud providers are either not affected (Vercel, Netlify), or protection can be turned on (Cloudflare).
segments.sourceMdx: A few days ago, Vercel announced a critical 9.1 vulnerability in Next.js middleware system. With a simple but malicious `x-middleware-subrequest` header, you can bypass the middleware, possibly exposing sensitive information. Patches are available for Next.js 12/13/14/15. Note that this vulnerability only affects self-hosted apps using `output: ‘standalone’` and `next start` are affected. Customers of major serverless cloud providers are either not affected (Vercel, Netlify), or protection can be turned on (Cloudflare).
segments.translated_content: 日前Vercel披露了Next.js中间件系统的9.1级高危漏洞。通过构造恶意的`x-middleware-subrequest`请求头，攻击者可绕过中间件防护，可能导致敏感信息泄露。Next.js 12/13/14/15均已发布补丁。需注意该漏洞仅影响使用`output: 'standalone'`配置并通过`next start`自托管的应用。主流无服务器云平台用户不受影响（Vercel、Netlify），或可手动开启防护（Cloudflare）。

segments.content: It's worth noting that even though Next.js middleware shouldn’t have this vulnerability, it is [not the recommended place to manage user sessions and protect routes](https://nextjs.org/docs/pages/building-your-application/authentication#optimistic-checks-with-middleware-optional), and shouldn’t be the only line of defense in your Next.js app. The middleware is more designed to perform lightweight optimistic checks, eventually rewriting/redirecting without hitting any DB.
segments.sourceMdx: It's worth noting that even though Next.js middleware shouldn’t have this vulnerability, it is [not the recommended place to manage user sessions and protect routes](https://nextjs.org/docs/pages/building-your-application/authentication#optimistic-checks-with-middleware-optional), and shouldn’t be the only line of defense in your Next.js app. The middleware is more designed to perform lightweight optimistic checks, eventually rewriting/redirecting without hitting any DB.
segments.translated_content: 值得注意的是，尽管Next.js中间件本不应存在此漏洞，但官方文档明确指出[不建议在此处管理用户会话和路由保护](https://nextjs.org/docs/pages/building-your-application/authentication#optimistic-checks-with-middleware-optional)，中间件不应作为Next.js应用的唯一防线。其设计初衷是执行轻量级的乐观检查，最终实现无需查询数据库的重定向/改写逻辑。

Vercel could have handled the situation better, and they plan to do better in the future. I’ll let you make your own opinion based on various resources, and there’s too many, so this is just a subset:

segments.content:
* 📜 [Next.js and the corrupt middleware: the authorizing artifact](https://zhero-web-sec.github.io/research-and-things/nextjs-and-the-corrupt-middleware): The original article from the security researchers who found the vulnerability.
* 📜 [How to Think About Security in Next.js](https://nextjs.org/blog/security-nextjs-server-components-actions): Older post but still a relevant read today.
* 📜 [Authorization in Next.js](https://www.robinwieruch.de/next-authorization/): Robin explains how he approaches authorization in Next.js projects, as close to the sensitive data as possible.
* 📜 [You should know this before choosing Next.js](https://eduardoboucas.com/posts/2025-03-25-you-should-know-this-before-choosing-nextjs/): The perspective from Netlify’s Principal Engineer.
* 🎥 [Theo - Next.js security exploit](https://www.youtube.com/live/UbcrphhSAIs?si=QgihLKnhpyE3RxPO\&t=8243): A 1h stream that on this topic, also explaining what Vercel did wrong.

segments.content: Believe it or not, React Native was [open-sourced exactly 10 years ago](https://engineering.fb.com/2015/03/26/android/react-native-bringing-modern-web-techniques-to-mobile/), and React Native is celebrating its first decade today!
segments.sourceMdx: Believe it or not, React Native was [open-sourced exactly 10 years ago](https://engineering.fb.com/2015/03/26/android/react-native-bringing-modern-web-techniques-to-mobile/), and React Native is celebrating its first decade today\!
segments.translated_content: 难以置信，React Native已在[十年前正式开源](https://engineering.fb.com/2015/03/26/android/react-native-bringing-modern-web-techniques-to-mobile/)，今天正是它问世十周年的日子！

segments.content: A huge shoutout to everyone who made it happen! Let’s take the opportunity to listen again to [this podcast episode with Christopher Chedeau](https://youtu.be/_cBqGenDCks?si=nrfF4D_FGEJhQsH3\&t=1504) (Vjeux, co-creator of React Native) where he explains the backstory of React Native, and how this great project could easily have died without ambitious people willing to bet on it.
segments.sourceMdx: A huge shoutout to everyone who made it happen\! Let’s take the opportunity to listen again to [this podcast episode with Christopher Chedeau](https://youtu.be/_cBqGenDCks?si=nrfF4D_FGEJhQsH3&t=1504) (Vjeux, co-creator of React Native) where he explains the backstory of React Native, and how this great project could easily have died without ambitious people willing to bet on it.
segments.translated_content: 向所有推动这一壮举的开发者致敬！让我们借此机会重温[Christopher Chedeau（Vjeux，React Native联合创始人）的播客访谈](https://youtu.be/_cBqGenDCks?si=nrfF4D_FGEJhQsH3&t=1504)，听他讲述React Native的诞生故事——这个伟大项目曾如何险些夭折，又是如何被一群敢于押注未来的开拓者拯救。

segments.content: Also a shoutout to the amazing React Native community—tight-knit, always pushing forward, tackling challenges, and building the future of native declarative UI together 🚀
segments.sourceMdx: Also a shoutout to the amazing React Native community—tight-knit, always pushing forward, tackling challenges, and building the future of native declarative UI together 🚀
segments.translated_content: 同样致敬React Native惊人的社区生态——紧密团结、锐意进取、攻坚克难，共同构建声明式原生UI的未来 🚀
为下一个辉煌十年干杯！🥂
